page.title: 08THE NORTH DEVON CLAY COMPANY
page.content:
The works of{The North Devon Clay {Company},situated to the west of our block,are of major importance in terms of land-use and employment.42 people work there to extract Ball Clay.
First dug in the 17th.century,the clay is used today in products as diverse as china,paint,pesticides,soap and tyres. Countries to which it is exported include Finland,Greece,India, New Zealand and U.S.A.
In the last 50 years the workforce has been reduced by two-thirds due to the introduction of mechanization and the closure of the Marland Brickworks. The distinctive yellow bricks,still to be found all over North Devon,together with the clay were once dispatched on a recently closed railway line.All products are now sent away by road.
